tools.one_line_profile: High-performance GPU-accelerated molecular simulation toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for molecular simulation, providing a high-performance library for running molecular dynamics on GPUs, with a flexible API for defining custom forces and integrators.

tools.name: OpenMM-ML
tools.one_line_profile: High-level API for using machine learning models in OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables the integration of machine learning potentials (such as ANI, TorchANI) directly into OpenMM simulations for hybrid or full ML-driven dynamics.

tools.name: OpenMM-PLUMED
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin to interface with PLUMED
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that connects OpenMM with the PLUMED library, allowing for free energy calculations, metadynamics, and analysis of collective variables during simulations.

tools.name: OpenMM Setup
tools.one_line_profile: GUI application for configuring and running OpenMM simulations
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly tool to prepare molecular systems, configure simulation parameters, and generate scripts for running OpenMM simulations.

tools.name: OpenMM-TensorFlow
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin to define forces with TensorFlow neural networks
tools.detailed_description: Allows users to define molecular forces or potential energy surfaces using TensorFlow models and use them within OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: OpenMM-Torch
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin to define forces with PyTorch neural networks
tools.detailed_description: Enables the use of PyTorch models to define forces and potential energies in OpenMM simulations, facilitating the deployment of ML potentials.

tools.name: openmmforcefields
tools.one_line_profile: CHARMM and AMBER forcefields for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing additional AMBER and CHARMM force fields for OpenMM, including support for small molecules via GAFF and other parameter sets.

tools.name: OpenPixi
tools.one_line_profile: Open Colored Particle-in-Cell (CPIC) simulator
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulator designed for educational and research purposes in plasma physics, featuring visualization capabilities.

tools.name: py_bh_tsne
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Barnes-Hut t-SNE
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the Barnes-Hut implementation of t-SNE (t-Distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding), a statistical method for visualizing high-dimensional data.

tools.name: OSIRIS
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art, fully relativistic, massively parallel Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code used for modeling plasma physics, laser-plasma interaction, and accelerator physics.

tools.name: Atomify
tools.one_line_profile: Realtime LAMMPS visualizer
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance visualization tool designed to render LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations in real-time, aiding in the analysis of atomistic processes.

tools.name: cg2at
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting coarse-grained structures to atomistic resolution
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that reconstructs all-atom structures from coarse-grained molecular dynamics simulations (specifically Martini force field), enabling multi-scale modeling workflows.

tools.name: fftool
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to build force field input files for molecular simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that generates input files (initial configuration and topology) for molecular dynamics simulations (LAMMPS, GROMACS) using polarizable or non-polarizable force fields.

tools.name: Starfish
tools.one_line_profile: 2D PIC-DSMC plasma and rarefied gas simulation program
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based simulation code that combines Particle-in-Cell (PIC) and Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) methods for modeling plasma and rarefied gas dynamics.

tools.name: OpenSPH
tools.one_line_profile: SPH/N-body library and application for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library and GUI application for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and N-body simulations, optimized for astrophysical problems like asteroid impacts and planet formation.

tools.name: Nbody-AI
tools.one_line_profile: N-body simulation and parameter retrieval using machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for generating N-body simulations and using Bayesian machine learning frameworks to retrieve orbital parameters from transit timing variations (TTV).

tools.name: VELOCIraptor-STF
tools.one_line_profile: Galaxy and Halo finder for N-body simulations
tools.detailed_description: A structure finder (Halo finder) for N-body and hydrodynamical simulations, capable of identifying galaxies, halos, and substructures in large cosmological datasets.

tools.name: StellarSolver
tools.one_line_profile: High-Performance N-Body Simulation with CUDA
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance N-body simulation tool utilizing CUDA and the Barnes-Hut algorithm to solve gravitational many-body problems efficiently on GPUs.

tools.name: lammps_interface
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic generation of LAMMPS input files for MOFs
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to automatically generate LAMMPS input files for molecular dynamics simulations of Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs), handling force field assignment and topology generation.

tools.name: PICLas
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel 3D PIC-DSMC solver for plasma simulation
tools.detailed_description: A flexible, parallel, three-dimensional Particle-in-Cell (PIC) and Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) solver for simulating plasma and gas flows, developed by the University of Stuttgart.

tools.name: PICMI
tools.one_line_profile: Standard input format and library for Particle-In-Cell codes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Particle-In-Cell Modeling Interface (PICMI) standard, allowing users to define PIC simulations in a code-agnostic way.

tools.name: Atomsk
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for manipulating and converting atomic data files
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool for creating, manipulating, and converting atomic data files for various computational materials science codes (LAMMPS, VASP, etc.).

tools.name: pic-python
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A compact, vectorized Python implementation of the Particle-in-Cell (PIC) method for plasma physics simulations. It solves the Vlasov-Maxwell system and is designed for educational and research prototyping purposes in plasma dynamics.

tools.name: sph-python
tools.one_line_profile: Smoothed-Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Smoothed-Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) for simulating fluid dynamics and astrophysical phenomena (e.g., toy star models). It serves as a concise solver for mesh-free fluid simulations.

tools.name: Python-Code-for-Stress-Constrained-Topology-Optimization-in-ABAQUS
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization scripts for ABAQUS FEA
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for performing stress-constrained topology optimization within the ABAQUS Finite Element Analysis environment. It implements methods like Optimality Criteria and Method of Moving Asymptotes for 2D and 3D structural problems.

tools.name: DEM-Engine
tools.one_line_profile: Dual-GPU Discrete Element Method (DEM) solver for granular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Discrete Element Method (DEM) solver leveraging dual-GPU acceleration. It supports complex grain geometries and is part of the Project Chrono ecosystem, designed for large-scale granular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: ProtoCaller
tools.one_line_profile: Automated workflow for relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that automates relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations using GROMACS. It handles ligand parametrization, system setup, and FEP simulation protocols.

tools.name: PSC
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics
tools.detailed_description: A Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for plasma physics simulations. It supports various algorithms for particle dynamics and field solving, suitable for research in plasma interactions.

tools.name: pyiron
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated development environment (IDE) for computational materials science workflows
tools.detailed_description: An integrated development environment (IDE) for computational materials science that simplifies the setup, execution, and analysis of complex simulation workflows. It supports various simulation codes and manages data provenance.

tools.name: pyiron_atomistics
tools.one_line_profile: Atomistic simulation module for the pyiron materials science IDE
tools.detailed_description: The atomistic simulation module of the pyiron IDE, providing interfaces and tools specifically for atomic-scale simulations (e.g., DFT, MD) within the pyiron framework.

tools.name: pylammpsmpi
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Python interface for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics engine
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides a parallel interface to LAMMPS, allowing users to control MPI-parallelized LAMMPS instances from a serial Python process or Jupyter notebook.

tools.name: pyscal
tools.one_line_profile: Library for calculating local atomic structural environments in atomistic simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library (written in C++) for the calculation of local atomic structural environments and order parameters (e.g., Steinhardt parameters, Voronoi analysis) from atomistic simulation data.

tools.name: Dock-MD-FEP
tools.one_line_profile: Automated workflow for protein-ligand binding free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: An all-in-one open-source workflow for automated binding free energy calculations between proteins and small molecules. It integrates docking, molecular dynamics, and free energy perturbation (FEP) using OpenMM.

tools.name: simba-ps
tools.one_line_profile: Deterministic Lennard-Jones particle simulator using Numba acceleration
tools.detailed_description: A fast, deterministic, all-Python particle simulator for Lennard-Jones systems. It utilizes Numba for GPU/CPU acceleration to perform efficient molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: apic2d
tools.one_line_profile: Affine Particle-in-Cell (APIC) solver for 2D fluid simulation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of the Affine Particle-in-Cell (APIC) method for 2D water simulation. It serves as a high-quality reference implementation for hybrid Lagrangian-Eulerian fluid simulation techniques.

tools.name: libwetcloth
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-scale simulation library for liquid-fabric interactions
tools.detailed_description: A multi-scale physics simulation library designed to model the interaction between liquids and fabrics. It handles complex dynamics involving wetting, saturation, and cloth mechanics.

tools.name: restraintmaker
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating position and distance restraints for molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to build position or distance restraints for Molecular Dynamics simulations. It can operate as a script or a PyMOL plugin, offering various selection modes and optimizers to distribute restraints effectively.

tools.name: XOOPIC
tools.one_line_profile: 2D/3V Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulator for plasma physics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source 2D, 3-velocity Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulator capable of handling electrostatic and electromagnetic models. It supports various boundary conditions and gas chemistry, widely used for plasma simulation.

tools.name: do_x3dna
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tool for DNA/RNA structural fluctuations in MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to analyze fluctuations in DNA or RNA structures from molecular dynamics trajectories, leveraging the 3DNA analysis programs.

tools.name: DEMLab
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulation tool in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based laboratory for Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulations, allowing for the modeling and analysis of granular material dynamics.

tools.name: torchani-amber
tools.one_line_profile: Interface for using ANI neural network potentials within Amber MD suite
tools.detailed_description: An interface that enables the use of ANI-style neural network interatomic potentials (NN-IPs) within the Amber molecular dynamics software suite (sander and pmemd engines).

tools.name: fmmgen
tools.one_line_profile: Code generator for Fast Multipole Method (FMM) and Barnes-Hut operators
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the automatic code generation of Fast Multipole Method (FMM) and Barnes-Hut operators, facilitating the development of high-performance N-body solvers.

tools.name: elegant
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerator physics code for beam dynamics and particle tracking
tools.detailed_description: A widely used tool for simulating particle accelerators. It models beam dynamics, tracks particles, and optimizes accelerator parameters, serving as a standard code in the accelerator physics community.

tools.name: OpenMMS
tools.one_line_profile: Software for Mobile Mapping Systems (MMS) data processing
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software project for Mobile Mapping Systems (MMS), handling data from hardware sensors (LiDAR, GPS/IMU) for geospatial mapping and analysis.

tools.name: gromacs_py
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for simplifying GROMACS molecular dynamics workflows
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies the use of the GROMACS MD simulation software. It automates topology building, system creation (solvation, ionization), and the execution of minimization, equilibration, and production runs.

tools.name: SEEKR2
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-Enabled Estimation of Kinetic Rates (Version 2)
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for calculating kinetics and thermodynamics of molecular binding using molecular dynamics and Brownian dynamics simulations.

tools.name: Selalib
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-Lagrangian Library for plasma physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A library of modular and reusable components for the simulation of kinetic equations in plasma physics, particularly using Semi-Lagrangian methods.

tools.name: PEGgenerator
tools.one_line_profile: Topology generator for PEG molecules in GROMACS and LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate topology files for Polyethylene Glycol (PEG) chains for use in molecular dynamics simulations with GROMACS or LAMMPS.

tools.name: NMRforMD
tools.one_line_profile: NMR relaxation time calculator from MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A Python script for calculating NMR relaxation times (T1 and T2) from molecular dynamics trajectory files.

tools.name: postpic
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processor for Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package for post-processing and analyzing data from Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations.

tools.name: SPH-EXA
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance C++20 SPH hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A C++20 simulation code for performing hydrodynamics simulations (with gravity and other physics), parallelized with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP.

tools.name: lammps-USER-CONP2
tools.one_line_profile: Constant potential plugin for LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: An updated constant potential plugin for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulator, enabling constant potential simulations.

tools.name: poly3d
tools.one_line_profile: Boundary element method for modeling faults and fractures
tools.detailed_description: A C-based Boundary Element Method (BEM) code for modeling faults and fractures discretized into polygonal elements in geophysics.

tools.name: dem-fem-coupling
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling of FEM and DEM using YADE and OOFEM
tools.detailed_description: Open source codes for coupling Finite Element Method (FEM) and Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulations using YADE and OOFEM software.

tools.name: NeuroFluid
tools.one_line_profile: Fluid Dynamics Grounding with Particle-Driven Neural Radiance Fields
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of NeuroFluid, a method for fluid dynamics grounding using particle-driven Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF).

tools.name: lunar-astrodynamics-simulation
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of orbital dynamics under Moon's gravitational field
tools.detailed_description: Numerical simulation tool for orbital dynamics under the Moon's non-uniform gravitational field (J2, mascons).

tools.name: simple-simulate-complex
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for protein-ligand complex simulation with OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A workflow/script collection for performing protein-ligand complex simulations using the OpenMM toolkit.

tools.name: ClayFF-GROMACS
tools.one_line_profile: GROMACS implementation of the ClayFF force field
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing the implementation and parameters of the ClayFF force field for use with the GROMACS molecular dynamics engine.

tools.name: WAND-PIC
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics simulations.

tools.name: nuc_dynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Particle dynamics for chromosome structure calculation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for particle dynamics and simulated annealing specifically designed for chromosome structure calculation.

tools.name: mddatasetbuilder
tools.one_line_profile: Dataset builder for neural network potentials from LAMMPS trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A script to build reference datasets for training neural network potentials using data from LAMMPS trajectories.

tools.name: mdgrad
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch differentiable molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A library for differentiable molecular dynamics simulations implemented in PyTorch, enabling gradient-based optimization of force field parameters.

tools.name: TorchMD
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-End Molecular Dynamics Engine using PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end Molecular Dynamics (MD) engine written in PyTorch, designed for machine learning applications and differentiable simulations.

tools.name: TTClust
tools.one_line_profile: Clustering tool for molecular dynamics trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A program to clusterize molecular dynamics trajectories from various engines (Amber, Gromacs, Charmm, NAMD, PDB).

tools.name: protocolGromacs
tools.one_line_profile: Automated GROMACS simulation protocol
tools.detailed_description: An automated protocol for GROMACS simulations, covering steps from preparation to production, including ligand parametrization.

tools.name: DMCF
tools.one_line_profile: Momentum-conserving learning for particle-based fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a method for guaranteed conservation of momentum in learning particle-based fluid dynamics (NeurIPS '22).

tools.name: JAX-SPH
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics Framework
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) framework implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization for fluid simulations.

tools.name: Particula
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based aerosol simulator
tools.detailed_description: An open-source aerosol simulator that captures gas-particle interactions, transformations, and dynamics for predictive aerosol science.

tools.name: Underworld2
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel PIC-FEM code for Geodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations.

tools.name: cfdemSolverIBPICI
tools.one_line_profile: Resolved CFD-DEM solver
tools.detailed_description: An alternative solver for fully resolved CFD-DEM simulations, developed by the Positron Imaging Centre.

tools.name: hoomd-tf
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow plugin for HOOMD-blue
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that enables the use of TensorFlow within HOOMD-blue simulations for GPU-accelerated machine learning enhanced molecular dynamics.

tools.name: JARVIS-Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source software package for data-driven atomistic materials design and analysis
tools.detailed_description: JARVIS-Tools is a Python library for atomistic materials design, providing scripts for setting up calculations, analyzing results, and applying machine learning models to material properties. It supports various electronic structure codes and integrates with the JARVIS database.

tools.name: DEMKit
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Element Method (DEM) toolkit for particle simulations
tools.detailed_description: DEMKit is a toolkit for performing Discrete Element Method simulations, focusing on granular materials and particle mechanics. It serves as a core engine for research in particle dynamics.

tools.name: PANTERA
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation software for nonequilibrium gas and plasma flows using DSMC and PIC methods
tools.detailed_description: PANTERA is an open-source solver developed by the Von Karman Institute for simulating nonequilibrium gas and plasma flows. It implements Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) and Particle-in-Cell (PIC) methods for rarefied gas dynamics and plasma physics.

tools.name: VOTCA
tools.one_line_profile: Coarse-grained modeling and charge transport analysis package
tools.detailed_description: VOTCA is a software package for coarse-grained modeling (VOTCA-CSG) and simulation of charge transport in organic semiconductors (VOTCA-XTP). It provides tools for systematic coarse-graining, matching effective potentials, and analyzing molecular dynamics trajectories.

tools.name: w2dynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Continuous-time hybridization-expansion Monte Carlo solver for DMFT
tools.detailed_description: w2dynamics is a software package for calculating n-particle Green's functions of the Anderson impurity model within dynamical mean-field theory (DMFT). It employs continuous-time quantum Monte Carlo (CT-QMC) in the hybridization-expansion formulation.

tools.name: openMaelstrom
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated SPH fluid simulation engine with spatial adaptivity
tools.detailed_description: openMaelstrom is an open-source Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulation framework designed for GPUs. It supports spatial adaptivity and is used for simulating fluid dynamics in physics and engineering contexts.

tools.name: OpenMMDL
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow interface for setting up OpenMM protein-ligand simulations
tools.detailed_description: OpenMMDL acts as an interface to the OpenMM toolkit, simplifying the setup process for molecular dynamics simulations of protein-ligand complexes. It streamlines the preparation, configuration, and execution of MD runs.

tools.name: xsuite
tools.one_line_profile: Python suite for multiparticle simulations of particle accelerators
tools.detailed_description: xsuite is a collection of Python packages designed for simulating the dynamics of particle beams in accelerators. It supports multiparticle tracking and beam physics simulations, optimized for modern computing architectures.

tools.name: fmmlib2d
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Multipole Method (FMM) library for 2D N-body problems
tools.detailed_description: fmmlib2d is a Fortran library implementing the Fast Multipole Method in two dimensions. It is a core numerical component for accelerating N-body simulations and potential field calculations.

tools.name: fmmlib3d
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Multipole Method (FMM) library for 3D N-body problems
tools.detailed_description: fmmlib3d is a Fortran library implementing the Fast Multipole Method in three dimensions. It provides efficient algorithms for computing potential fields and interactions in large-scale N-body simulations.

tools.name: lammps-conp
tools.one_line_profile: Constant potential method implementation for LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: lammps-conp is an extension for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulator that implements the constant potential method. It allows for the simulation of electrode-electrolyte interfaces where electrodes are maintained at a constant electrical potential.

tools.name: PCISPH
tools.one_line_profile: Predictive-Corrective Incompressible SPH fluid simulation solver
tools.detailed_description: PCISPH is an OpenCL-accelerated implementation of the Predictive-Corrective Incompressible Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics method. It is used for simulating incompressible fluid flows with particle-based methods.

tools.name: 4C
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive multiphysics simulation framework for continuum mechanics
tools.detailed_description: 4C is a comprehensive multiphysics simulation framework written in C++ that focuses on continuum mechanics and related fields, providing capabilities for complex physical simulations.

tools.name: molview
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for interactive molecular visualization based on Mol*
tools.detailed_description: An IPython/Jupyter widget that brings the capabilities of the Mol* (Molstar) viewer into the notebook environment for interactive molecular visualization.

tools.name: ADplugin
tools.one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for AutoDock/Vina molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the PyMOL molecular visualization system that integrates AutoDock and Vina, allowing users to set up and analyze molecular docking simulations directly within PyMOL.

tools.name: Alphafold2import
tools.one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin to import AlphaFold2 models from EMBL database
tools.detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin that facilitates the fetching and importing of AlphaFold2 predicted protein structures hosted by EMBL directly into the PyMOL environment.

tools.name: cpptraj
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and robust trajectory analysis tool for Amber and other MD packages
tools.detailed_description: Cpptraj is the main trajectory analysis tool for the Amber Molecular Dynamics package, capable of reading and processing a wide variety of trajectory and topology formats.

tools.name: Jupyter_Dock
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive molecular docking protocols in Jupyter Notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A set of Jupyter Notebooks designed to perform molecular docking protocols interactively, including visualization, file format conversion, and result analysis.

tools.name: molecular-design-toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Notebook-integrated tools for molecular simulation and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit that integrates molecular simulation and visualization capabilities directly into Jupyter notebooks, facilitating computational chemistry workflows.

tools.name: notebook-molecular-visualization
tools.one_line_profile: 2D and 3D molecular visualization in Jupyter notebooks
tools.detailed_description: Provides capabilities for embedding 2D and 3D molecular visualizations within Jupyter notebooks using 3Dmol.js and D3.js libraries.

tools.name: PyMOL-PUB
tools.one_line_profile: Plugin for generating publication-quality structure figures in PyMOL
tools.detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin designed to streamline the creation of high-quality, publication-ready molecular structure figures.

tools.name: PyMolSAR
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for molecular feature computation and activity prediction
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit used to compute molecular features and predict biological activities and properties of small molecules, often used in SAR studies.

tools.name: hop
tools.one_line_profile: Solvent network analysis tool based on MDAnalysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package based on MDAnalysis for analyzing solvation dynamics and solvent networks in molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: imdclient
tools.one_line_profile: Client for streaming analysis from running MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python client for performing streaming analysis on molecular dynamics simulations while they are running, supporting interactive MD workflows.

tools.name: propkatraj
tools.one_line_profile: pKa estimates for proteins using MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A tool to calculate pKa values for protein residues across an ensemble of structures from molecular dynamics trajectories.

tools.name: zarrtraj
tools.one_line_profile: MDAnalysis toolkit for Zarr-based trajectory storage
tools.detailed_description: An MDAKit that provides functionality for reading and writing molecular dynamics trajectories using the Zarr format within the MDAnalysis ecosystem.

tools.name: ASAP
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Selection And Prediction tools for structural analysis
tools.detailed_description: ASAP is a python package for quickly analyzing and visualizing datasets of crystal or molecular structures, often used in conjunction with machine learning potentials.

tools.name: ring-pymol
tools.one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for Residue Interaction Network Generator (RING)
tools.detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin that visualizes residue interaction networks generated by the RING software, aiding in the analysis of protein structure stability and function.

tools.name: MasterMSM
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for generating Markov State Models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for the construction and analysis of Markov State Models (MSMs) from molecular dynamics simulation data.

tools.name: domhmm
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to identify nano- and microdomains in membrane MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: An open source package used to identify and analyze lipid domains (nano- and microdomains) in molecular dynamics simulations of biological membranes.

tools.name: NetworkGT
tools.one_line_profile: Network Geometry and Topology Toolbox for fracture networks
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for the geometrical and topological analysis of fracture networks, applicable in geophysics and materials science.

tools.name: Jmol-SwingJS
tools.one_line_profile: SwingJS-compatible version of Jmol/JSmol
tools.detailed_description: A version of the Jmol molecular visualization and analysis tool compatible with SwingJS, enabling Java-based molecular tools to run in web environments.

tools.name: Molecules
tools.one_line_profile: 3D molecular visualizer for iOS
tools.detailed_description: An open-source application for viewing and manipulating 3D molecular structures on iOS devices.

tools.name: MoleculesMac
tools.one_line_profile: 3D molecular visualizer for macOS
tools.detailed_description: The macOS desktop version of the Molecules application for visualizing 3D molecular structures.

tools.name: MolecularNodes
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular animation and visualization in Blender via Geometry Nodes
tools.detailed_description: A Blender add-on that enables the import and manipulation of molecular data using Geometry Nodes for high-quality visualization and animation.

tools.name: Caleydo
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization framework for molecular biology data
tools.detailed_description: Caleydo is a visualization framework and tool designed to help life science experts analyze and explore large-scale molecular biology data.

tools.name: DISC
tools.one_line_profile: Single-molecule trajectory idealization tool
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB tool for single-molecule trajectory idealization using divisive segmentation and clustering, developed by ChandaLab.

tools.name: colvars
tools.one_line_profile: Collective variables library for molecular simulation
tools.detailed_description: A software module for molecular simulation programs that provides a flexible and robust implementation of collective variables and enhanced sampling methods.

tools.name: phlower
tools.one_line_profile: Trajectory analysis using Hodge decomposition
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that utilizes Hodge decomposition for the analysis of trajectories, providing insights into the global structure of dynamics.

tools.name: pymol-remote
tools.one_line_profile: Remote interface for PyMOL visualization from compute clusters
tools.detailed_description: A utility to send data to and from a local PyMOL instance from a remote server, facilitating visualization workflows where heavy computation (e.g., deep learning, MD) occurs on a cluster.

tools.name: CueMol
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive molecular visualization framework
tools.detailed_description: CueMol is a molecular visualization framework designed to visualize crystallographic data and molecular coordinates, supporting various rendering modes and scene setups.

tools.name: msys
tools.one_line_profile: System preparation and analysis library for molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A library developed by D. E. Shaw Research for preparing and analyzing chemical systems for molecular dynamics simulations, handling topology and structure data.

tools.name: Building-Regulariser
tools.one_line_profile: Geospatial tool for regularizing building footprints

tools.name: pdbcolor
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to color PDB structures based on sequence alignment parameters
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that assigns colors to PDB structures based on quantitative data derived from multiple sequence alignments, aiding in the visualization of evolutionary conservation or other sequence-based properties on 3D structures.

tools.name: PySDKit
tools.one_line_profile: Library for signal decomposition algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing various signal decomposition algorithms (like EMD, EEMD, VMD) for analyzing non-linear and non-stationary time-series data, suitable for physical signal analysis.

tools.name: traclus
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of the TRACLUS trajectory clustering algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A Java implementation of the 'Trajectory Clustering: A Partition-and-Group Framework' (TRACLUS) algorithm, used for discovering common sub-trajectories in spatial trajectory data.

tools.name: artefact
tools.one_line_profile: Autoencoder and t-SNE for anomaly detection in aircraft trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A toolset for detecting anomalies in aircraft trajectories using deep learning (Autoencoders) and dimensionality reduction (t-SNE) techniques.

tools.name: PyMOL-Wasm
tools.one_line_profile: WebAssembly port of the PyMOL molecular visualization system
tools.detailed_description: A port of the PyMOL molecular visualization system to WebAssembly, enabling molecular structures to be viewed and analyzed directly in a web browser.

tools.name: trajectory2vec
tools.one_line_profile: Deep representation learning for trajectory clustering
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a deep learning approach to learn representations (embeddings) of trajectories, facilitating downstream tasks like clustering and classification of movement data.

tools.name: pytorch-deep-markov-model
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Deep Markov Models for time series
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of Structured Inference Networks for Nonlinear State Space Models (Deep Markov Models), useful for modeling complex temporal dynamics and time-series data.

tools.name: MDToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB/Octave toolbox for statistical analysis of MD trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for MATLAB and Octave designed for the statistical analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories, including functions for I/O, least-squares fitting, and various structural analysis metrics.

tools.name: Trajectory-PMB-EOT-BP
tools.one_line_profile: Trajectory Poisson Multi-Bernoulli filter for extended object tracking
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a trajectory Poisson multi-Bernoulli (PMB) filter using particle belief propagation, designed for tracking multiple extended objects and estimating their trajectories.

tools.name: fenics-topopt
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of topology optimization algorithms utilizing the FEniCS finite element analysis library, suitable for structural optimization problems.

tools.name: SPaMD
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated platform for atomic-scale materials modeling, simulation, and visualization
tools.detailed_description: SPaMD (Scalable Parallel Materials/Molecular Design/Dynamics Studio) is an integrated software platform dedicated to the modeling, calculation, simulation, analysis, and visualization of materials at the atomic scale. It is developed by the research group of Professor Ruifeng Zhang at Beihang University.

tools.name: KHARMA
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-enabled general relativistic magnetohydrodynamics (GRMHD) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: KHARMA (Kokkos-based High-Accuracy Relativistic Magnetohydrodynamics with AMR) is a GRMHD code designed for simulating accretion flows onto black holes. It leverages the Kokkos performance portability library to run efficiently on various architectures including GPUs, and uses the Parthenon framework for adaptive mesh refinement (AMR).

tools.name: Castro
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible astrophysics simulation code for massive parallel architectures
tools.detailed_description: Castro is an adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) radiation-hydrodynamics code for astrophysical simulations. It supports compressible hydrodynamics, radiation transport, and self-gravity, designed to scale on massively parallel CPU and GPU systems using the AMReX framework.

tools.name: MAESTROeX
tools.one_line_profile: Low Mach number stellar hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: MAESTROeX is a C++ code for simulating low Mach number stratified astrophysical flows, such as those in stellar evolution. It uses the AMReX framework for adaptive mesh refinement and parallel scalability.

tools.name: AMReX-Astro Microphysics
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of microphysics routines for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains common astrophysical microphysics modules (nuclear networks, equations of state, opacity) designed to interface with AMReX-based simulation codes like Castro and MAESTROeX.

tools.name: Amrvis
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization package for AMReX-based simulation data
tools.detailed_description: Amrvis is a specialized visualization tool designed to read, display, and analyze output data (plotfiles) and profiling data from scientific codes built on the AMReX framework.

tools.name: AMReX
tools.one_line_profile: Software framework for block-structured adaptive mesh refinement
tools.detailed_description: AMReX is a high-performance software framework for building massively parallel, block-structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) applications. It supports CPU and GPU architectures and provides core functionality for solving PDEs in complex domains.

tools.name: pyamrex
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-enabled Python bindings for the AMReX framework
tools.detailed_description: pyamrex provides zero-copy Python bindings for AMReX, allowing users to write AMReX-based applications or interface with AI/ML libraries using Python while maintaining high performance on GPUs.

tools.name: PeleAnalysis
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and processing tools for reacting flow simulations
tools.detailed_description: PeleAnalysis is a suite of post-processing and analysis tools designed for use with the Pele family of combustion codes (PeleC, PeleLMeX), facilitating the interpretation of reacting flow simulation data.

tools.name: PeleC
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible reacting flow simulation code with AMR
tools.detailed_description: PeleC is an adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for solving compressible reacting flows. It is part of the Pele suite and is designed for high-performance simulations of combustion processes on modern supercomputers.

tools.name: PeleLMeX
tools.one_line_profile: Low Mach number reacting flow simulation code
tools.detailed_description: PeleLMeX is an adaptive mesh hydrodynamics code for simulating low Mach number reacting flows. It is the successor to PeleLM and supports complex combustion simulations without level sub-cycling.

tools.name: PeleMP
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics models for the Pele combustion suite
tools.detailed_description: PeleMP provides multiphysics modeling capabilities (such as spray and soot models) for the Pele suite of combustion codes, extending their applicability to complex physical phenomena.

tools.name: PelePhysics
tools.one_line_profile: Physics databases and routines for combustion simulations
tools.detailed_description: PelePhysics is a repository of physics databases (thermodynamics, transport, kinetics) and implementation code shared across the Pele suite of combustion codes.

tools.name: FHDeX
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic hybrid models and algorithms for fluctuating hydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: FHDeX provides AMReX-enabled code libraries for simulating fluctuating hydrodynamics using stochastic hybrid models and algorithms, suitable for mesoscale fluid simulations.

tools.name: LBMeX
tools.one_line_profile: Lattice Boltzmann methods implementation on AMReX
tools.detailed_description: LBMeX implements Lattice Boltzmann methods (LBM) using the AMReX software framework, enabling scalable fluid dynamics simulations on parallel architectures.

tools.name: AMReX-Hydro
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrodynamics routines for AMReX-based codes
tools.detailed_description: AMReX-Hydro provides a collection of hydrodynamics routines and solvers built on the AMReX framework, serving as a building block for various fluid dynamics applications.

tools.name: IAMR
tools.one_line_profile: Variable-density incompressible Navier-Stokes solver with AMR
tools.detailed_description: IAMR is a parallel, adaptive mesh refinement code that solves the variable-density incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, suitable for a wide range of fluid flow problems.

tools.name: incflo
tools.one_line_profile: Incompressible Navier-Stokes solver for complex geometries
tools.detailed_description: incflo is an AMReX-based solver for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, specifically designed to handle complex geometries and embedded boundaries.

tools.name: FerroX
tools.one_line_profile: Phase-field simulation framework for ferroelectric materials
tools.detailed_description: FerroX is a massively parallel, 3D phase-field simulation framework built on AMReX. It models ferroelectric materials for scalable logic devices, solving the time-dependent Ginzburg-Landau equation coupled with Poisson's equation.

tools.name: ARTEMIS
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh time-domain electrodynamics solver for microelectronics
tools.detailed_description: ARTEMIS couples Maxwell's equations (from WarpX) with classical equations for quantum materials (like LLG for micromagnetics and London for superconductors) to quantify next-generation microelectronics performance.

tools.name: taichi.js
tools.one_line_profile: Modern GPU compute and physics rendering in JavaScript
tools.detailed_description: taichi.js is a JavaScript library that enables developers to write high-performance GPU compute and rendering kernels (based on the Taichi programming language concepts) directly in the browser, suitable for web-based physics simulations and visualizations.

tools.name: rscope
tools.one_line_profile: RL training visualizer for Mujoco Playground environments
tools.detailed_description: rscope is a visualization tool for Reinforcement Learning training processes, specifically designed for Mujoco Playground environments and Brax. It aids in analyzing the behavior and performance of physics-based control policies.

tools.name: DDC
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Domain Computation library for HPC
tools.detailed_description: DDC (Discrete Domain Computation) is a C++ library designed to simplify the development of high-performance scientific codes by providing abstractions for discretized domains and fields, supporting parallelism and GPU acceleration.

tools.name: TCLB
tools.one_line_profile: Templated MPI+CUDA/CPU Lattice Boltzmann code
tools.detailed_description: TCLB is a high-performance Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) code that uses C++ templates for efficient code generation on both CPUs and GPUs (via CUDA). It supports MPI for large-scale parallel fluid simulations.

tools.name: PyQUDA
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for the QUDA library for Lattice QCD
tools.detailed_description: PyQUDA provides a Pythonic interface to QUDA, a library for performing Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD) calculations on GPUs. It facilitates QCD research by combining Python's ease of use with QUDA's performance.

tools.name: larnd-sim
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for DUNE pixelated Liquid Argon TPC
tools.detailed_description: larnd-sim is a simulation framework specifically designed for the pixelated Liquid Argon Time Projection Chambers (LArTPC) used in the DUNE experiment. It simulates the detector response and physics of neutrino interactions.

tools.name: EKAT
tools.one_line_profile: HPC C++ utilities and libraries for the E3SM ecosystem using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: Tools and libraries for writing Kokkos-enabled HPC C++ in the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) ecosystem, providing support for performance portability.

tools.name: SCREAM
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale global atmosphere model written in C++
tools.detailed_description: A fork of E3SM used to develop the Simple Cloud-Resolving E3SM Atmosphere Model (SCREAM), designed for exascale computing architectures.

tools.name: Cabana
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable library for particle-based simulations
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable library for particle-based simulations, developed as part of the Exascale Computing Project (ECP) Co-design Center for Particle Applications (CoPA).

tools.name: CabanaMD
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics proxy application based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for molecular dynamics simulations built on top of the Cabana performance-portable particle library.

tools.name: Cajita
tools.one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos library for logically rectilinear grids
tools.detailed_description: A library for managing logically rectilinear grids using MPI and Kokkos, supporting grid-based scientific simulations.

tools.name: ExaMPM
tools.one_line_profile: Material point method proxy application based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for the Material Point Method (MPM) built on the Cabana library, used for continuum mechanics simulations.

tools.name: evox
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed GPU-Accelerated Framework for Evolutionary Computation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library and distributed GPU-accelerated framework for evolutionary computation algorithms and benchmark problems.

tools.name: metade
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated evolutionary framework for Differential Evolution
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated evolutionary framework that optimizes Differential Evolution (DE) strategies via meta-level evolution, supporting JAX and PyTorch.

tools.name: tensorneat
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT)
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated implementation of the NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT) algorithm for evolving neural networks.

tools.name: tensorrvea
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated framework for Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization using Tensorized RVEA (Reference Vector Guided Evolutionary Algorithm).

tools.name: NeRF-NCNN
tools.one_line_profile: NeRF implementation in NCNN with C++ and Vulkan
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) using the NCNN framework and Vulkan for efficient inference, enabling 3D scene reconstruction and rendering.

tools.name: CarpetX
tools.one_line_profile: Cactus driver for the Einstein Toolkit based on AMReX
tools.detailed_description: A driver for the Cactus computational toolkit based on the AMReX framework, enabling adaptive mesh refinement for relativistic astrophysics simulations within the Einstein Toolkit.

tools.name: AdaPT
tools.one_line_profile: Physically based mesh renderer based on Taichi lang
tools.detailed_description: A physically based path tracer (Ada Path Tracer) implemented in Taichi, designed for rendering meshes with physical accuracy.

tools.name: amr-wind
tools.one_line_profile: AMReX-based structured wind solver
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel, block-structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for wind farm simulations, built on the AMReX library.

tools.name: GRTeclyn
tools.one_line_profile: Port of GRChombo to AMReX for General Relativity simulations
tools.detailed_description: A numerical relativity code porting the functionality of GRChombo to the AMReX framework, enabling adaptive mesh refinement simulations of General Relativity.

tools.name: nBody
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-Body particle simulator with visualizer
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated N-Body particle simulator that includes a visualizer, designed for simulating gravitational or electrostatic interactions between particles.

tools.name: DiffTactile
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based Differentiable Tactile Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A physics-based differentiable tactile simulator designed for contact-rich robotic manipulation tasks, enabling gradient-based optimization for control and perception.

tools.name: Genesis
tools.one_line_profile: Generative world for general-purpose robotics & embodied AI learning
tools.detailed_description: A simulation platform for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI, providing a generative world environment for physical simulation and learning.

tools.name: ThinShellLab
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulations for thin-shell object manipulations
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics simulation environment specifically designed for manipulating thin-shell objects, enabling learning and optimization for deformable object manipulation.

tools.name: GooFit
tools.one_line_profile: Massively-parallel framework for maximum-likelihood fits
tools.detailed_description: A massively-parallel framework for performing maximum-likelihood fits, implemented in CUDA and OpenMP, primarily used in High Energy Physics analysis.

tools.name: optiland
tools.one_line_profile: Optical design, optimization, and analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python tool for optical design, optimization, and analysis, featuring GPU-accelerated and differentiable ray tracing via PyTorch.

tools.name: N-body-simulation
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time N-body simulation with Barnes-Hut and CUDA
tools.detailed_description: A real-time N-body simulation tool implementing the Barnes-Hut algorithm and accelerated with CUDA.

tools.name: athenak
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable astrophysical AMR-MHD code using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code, rewritten using Kokkos.

tools.name: jaxrenderer
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Rasteriser implemented in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable rasterizer implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization for rendering tasks, useful in inverse graphics and physics.

tools.name: PINNs-based-MPC
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Model Predictive Control
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of nonlinear model predictive control (NMPC) for multi-body dynamics using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) to approximate system dynamics.

tools.name: ExaCA
tools.one_line_profile: Cellular automata code for alloy nucleation and solidification
tools.detailed_description: A cellular automata code written with Kokkos for simulating alloy nucleation and solidification, designed for exascale computing platforms.

tools.name: ddcMD
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated molecular dynamics for Martini force field
tools.detailed_description: A fully GPU-accelerated molecular dynamics program specifically optimized for the Martini coarse-grained force field.

tools.name: exadis
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Dislocation Simulator for Discrete Dislocation Dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A portable library for Discrete Dislocation Dynamics (DDD) simulations that runs on GPUs, designed for exascale materials science simulations.

tools.name: SIMULATeQCD
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-GPU Lattice QCD framework
tools.detailed_description: A multi-GPU Lattice QCD framework designed to make it easy for physicists to implement lattice QCD formulas while providing competitive performance.

tools.name: SevenNet
tools.one_line_profile: Graph neural network interatomic potential for multi-GPU MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: SevenNet is a graph neural network interatomic potential package designed for efficient multi-GPU parallel molecular dynamics simulations, enabling large-scale and long-time simulations of materials.

tools.name: MFC
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale simulation framework for multiphase fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: MFC (Multi-Component Flow Code) is an open-source high-order solver for multiphase, compressible, and reacting flows, designed for exascale high-performance computing systems.

tools.name: pytorch-softdtw-cuda
tools.one_line_profile: Fast CUDA implementation of SoftDTW for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A highly optimized CUDA implementation of Soft Dynamic Time Warping (SoftDTW) for PyTorch, enabling differentiable time series alignment and analysis on GPUs.

tools.name: pycharge
tools.one_line_profile: Electromagnetics simulation library for moving point charges
tools.detailed_description: PyCharge is a Python library built on JAX for simulating the electromagnetic fields and potentials generated by moving point charges, supporting differentiable simulations.

tools.name: torchoptics
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable wave optics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: TorchOptics is a differentiable wave optics simulation library built on PyTorch, enabling gradient-based optimization and simulation of optical systems.

tools.name: NVIDIA Warp
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for high-performance simulation and graphics
tools.detailed_description: Warp is a Python framework that provides a high-performance JIT compiler for writing differentiable graphics and physics simulation kernels that run on the GPU.

tools.name: ProtoMotions
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated simulation for digital humans and robots
tools.detailed_description: ProtoMotions is a GPU-accelerated simulation and learning framework designed for training physically simulated digital humans and humanoid robots using reinforcement learning.

tools.name: feax
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based finite element analysis engine
tools.detailed_description: feax is a compact, high-performance finite element analysis (FEA) engine built on JAX, enabling differentiable structural analysis and optimization.

tools.name: CabanaPD
tools.one_line_profile: Peridynamics simulation with Cabana library
tools.detailed_description: CabanaPD is a library for peridynamics simulations implemented using the Cabana performance portability library, designed for particle-based fracture and mechanics simulations on HPC systems.

tools.name: pennylane-lightning-kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-enabled Lightning simulator for PennyLane
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance state-vector simulator for the PennyLane quantum machine learning library, utilizing Kokkos for parallel execution on various hardware backends (CPU/GPU).

tools.name: phasicFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel DEM and CFD-DEM simulation code
tools.detailed_description: phasicFlow is a parallel, high-efficiency code for Discrete Element Method (DEM) and coupled CFD-DEM simulations of granular and multiphase flows on CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: openLBMPM
tools.one_line_profile: LBM package for multicomponent/multiphase flow in porous media
tools.detailed_description: openLBMPM is an open-source Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) package specifically designed for simulating multicomponent and multiphase flow and transport in porous media using CUDA acceleration.

tools.name: pressio-rom
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reduced order modeling and solvers
tools.detailed_description: pressio-rom is a C++ library providing infrastructure for reduced order modeling (ROM), including linear/non-linear solvers and time integration schemes, designed for performance portability.

tools.name: SPECFEMPP
tools.one_line_profile: C++ rewrite of the SPECFEM seismic wave simulation suite
tools.detailed_description: SPECFEM++ is a modern C++ implementation of the SPECFEM suite for simulating seismic wave propagation, aiming for high performance and modularity in geophysics simulations.

tools.name: FluidX3D
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Lattice Boltzmann CFD software
tools.detailed_description: FluidX3D is a highly optimized Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) CFD software that runs on GPUs via OpenCL, offering fast and memory-efficient fluid simulations.

tools.name: beamz
tools.one_line_profile: Electromagnetic simulation and inverse design tool
tools.detailed_description: beamz is a Python library for fast electromagnetic simulation and inverse design, utilizing JAX for differentiability and acceleration.

tools.name: torch-diffsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A minimal, parallelizable physics simulator supporting differentiation entirely within PyTorch, suitable for learning-based control and physical parameter estimation.

tools.name: hpx-kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Interoperability library for HPX and Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables the interoperability between HPX (a C++ standard library for concurrency and parallelism) and Kokkos (a performance portability ecosystem). It allows scientific applications to leverage asynchronous task-based parallelism alongside performance-portable kernels.

tools.name: Octo-Tiger
tools.one_line_profile: Astrophysics simulation code using fast multipole method on adaptive Octrees
tools.detailed_description: An astrophysics code for simulating the evolution of star systems (like binary star mergers). It uses the Fast Multipole Method (FMM) on adaptive Octrees and is optimized for HPC systems using HPX for parallelism.

tools.name: Simple Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance physics simulator for robotics and manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A physics simulator designed for robotics research, focusing on simplicity and performance. It supports rigid body dynamics and is used for testing control algorithms and robot learning.

tools.name: MuJoCo-LiDAR
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance LiDAR simulation for MuJoCo
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance LiDAR simulation tool based on the MuJoCo physics engine. It supports multiple backends (CPU, Taichi, Jax) and integrates with ROS, enabling realistic sensor simulation for robotics research.

tools.name: skrl
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Reinforcement Learning library for robotics and physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: skrl is a reinforcement learning library designed for modularity and readability. It supports PyTorch, JAX, and integrates with physics-based environments like NVIDIA Isaac Lab, Omniverse, and MuJoCo for robot learning.

tools.name: BabelStream
tools.one_line_profile: Memory bandwidth benchmark for diverse HPC architectures
tools.detailed_description: BabelStream is a benchmark tool for measuring memory transfer rates (bandwidth) across a wide range of processing devices (CPUs, GPUs) and programming models (CUDA, OpenCL, Kokkos, SYCL, etc.). It is essential for evaluating hardware performance for scientific computing.

tools.name: PararealML
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning boosted parallel-in-time differential equation solver
tools.detailed_description: A framework that implements the Parareal algorithm (parallel-in-time integration) augmented with machine learning surrogates to accelerate the solution of differential equations.

tools.name: IonSolver
tools.one_line_profile: Magnetohydrodynamic simulation software using Lattice Boltzmann method
tools.detailed_description: IonSolver is a simulation tool for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) utilizing an extended Lattice Boltzmann method (LBM) with GPU acceleration capabilities.

tools.name: viskores
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization library for many-threaded devices
tools.detailed_description: A visualization library designed for high-performance, many-threaded devices (like GPUs), enabling in-situ visualization for scientific simulations.

tools.name: Lattice-Boltzmann-Method-GPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 3D Lattice Boltzmann CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-based Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver implementing the Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) for 3D single-phase flows, offering significant speedup over CPU implementations.

tools.name: GeoTaichi
tools.one_line_profile: Taichi-powered simulator for geophysical problems
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance numerical simulator built with Taichi, designed for solving multiscale and multifield geophysical problems.

tools.name: gpu-io
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated physics simulation library for the web
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing GPU-accelerated physics simulations and mathematical computations directly in a web browser, supporting fluid dynamics, reaction-diffusion, and particle systems.

tools.name: jaxsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine and multibody dynamics library in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine implemented in JAX, designed for robot learning and control. It allows for gradient-based optimization of multibody dynamics.

tools.name: ArborX
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable geometric search library for HPC
tools.detailed_description: ArborX is a library for geometric search (e.g., bounding volume hierarchies, nearest neighbor search) designed for high-performance computing applications. It supports various backends (CUDA, HIP, Kokkos) for acceleration.

tools.name: pinnfactory
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs)
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight framework for building and training Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs). It integrates symbolic PDE definitions with PyTorch's automatic differentiation to solve forward and inverse physics problems.

tools.name: rakau
tools.one_line_profile: C++17 N-body Barnes-Hut library for heterogeneous hardware architectures
tools.detailed_description: A C++17 library implementing the Barnes-Hut N-body algorithm, designed for high performance on heterogeneous hardware architectures including CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: SciBmad.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface for the Bmad accelerator physics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A modular, polymorphic, and differentiable accelerator physics code in Julia, providing portability across CPU and GPU architectures as part of the Bmad ecosystem.

tools.name: GPUMD
tools.one_line_profile: General-purpose molecular dynamics simulation package for GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A highly efficient molecular dynamics simulation package designed specifically for Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), enabling large-scale atomistic simulations.

tools.name: Celeritas
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Monte Carlo transport code for high energy physics
tools.detailed_description: A Monte Carlo transport code designed to accelerate high energy physics detector simulations by leveraging GPUs for improved throughput and energy efficiency.

tools.name: perses
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for alchemical free energy calculations and chemical space exploration
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for performing alchemical free energy calculations and exploring chemical space using expanded ensembles, built on top of OpenMM.

tools.name: ufedmm
tools.one_line_profile: Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) implementation for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) for enhanced sampling simulations using the OpenMM engine.

tools.name: MonoForce
tools.one_line_profile: Learnable image-conditioned physics engine for robot-terrain interaction
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine designed to predict robot-terrain interactions by fusing RGB and LiDAR data, enabling learnable physical modeling for robotics.

tools.name: evoxels
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics framework for voxel-based microstructure simulations
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics framework specifically designed for simulating voxel-based microstructures, enabling gradient-based optimization of material properties.

tools.name: Dojo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine for robotics in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine written in Julia, designed for robotics simulation and control, supporting gradient-based optimization.

tools.name: ParticleSolver
tools.one_line_profile: CPU and GPU particle-based physics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A library providing CPU and GPU implementations of particle-based physics simulations, based on the Unified Particle Physics for Real-Time Application method.

tools.name: ERF
tools.one_line_profile: Energy Research and Forecasting Model
tools.detailed_description: A modeling system for energy research and forecasting, designed to simulate atmospheric flows and their interaction with energy systems.

tools.name: Tiny Differentiable Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Header-only C++ and CUDA differentiable physics library
tools.detailed_description: A zero-dependency, header-only C++ and CUDA physics library designed for reinforcement learning and robotics, supporting differentiable simulation.

tools.name: tmLQCD
tools.one_line_profile: Lattice QCD simulation software suite
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for Lattice QCD simulations, implementing HMC and various fermion actions, fully parallelized for modern HPC architectures.

tools.name: FBPIC

tools.detailed_description: A Python-based 3D electromagnetic Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) simulator. It provides a simple interface for defining geometries, sources, and detectors to simulate electromagnetic wave propagation, with optional GPU acceleration via PyTorch.

tools.name: Brax

tools.detailed_description: Brax is a differentiable physics engine that simulates massive numbers of environments in parallel on hardware accelerators (GPUs/TPUs). tools.detailed_description: Idefix is a finite volume code designed for astrophysical fluid dynamics simulations. It uses Kokkos to achieve performance portability across various architectures (CPU, GPU) and supports hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD).
