tools.one_line_profile: PINNs for Computational Mechanics based on DeepXDE
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) specifically tailored for computational mechanics problems, built on top of the DeepXDE framework.

tools.name: VENI-VINDy-VICI
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable data-driven framework for generative reduced order models
tools.detailed_description: A framework for building generative reduced order models (ROMs) with embedded uncertainty quantification, focusing on interpretability and data-driven discovery.

tools.name: position_induced_transformer
tools.one_line_profile: Position-induced Transformer for operator learning in PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the Position-induced Transformer, a model designed for operator learning tasks to solve partial differential equations.

tools.name: DeepXDE
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for scientific machine learning and physics-informed neural networks
tools.detailed_description: DeepXDE is a powerful library for scientific machine learning (SciML), specifically designed for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using physics-informed neural networks (PINNs), DeepONet, and other operator learning methods. It supports multiple backends (TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX, PaddlePaddle) and provides a unified interface for solving forward and inverse problems in physics and engineering.

tools.name: EZyRB
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Model Order Reduction (MOR) of parametric physical systems
tools.detailed_description: EZyRB (Easy Reduced Basis method) is a Python library for performing Model Order Reduction (MOR) on parametric physical systems. It implements methods such as Proper Orthogonal Decomposition (POD) and AutoEncoders to construct reduced order models from high-fidelity data.

tools.name: PINA
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs)
tools.detailed_description: PINA (Physics-Informed Neural networks for Advanced modeling) is a Python package that provides an intuitive interface for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) and approximating functions using Physics-Informed Neural Networks. It supports various problem definitions and training strategies.

tools.name: AI4FluidSimulations
tools.one_line_profile: Library for training large-scale surrogate models for fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ codebase/library designed to train large-scale surrogate models for fluid simulation tasks, specifically targeting CO2 flow in porous media and solving 3D Navier-Stokes equations. It serves as a high-performance tool for AI-accelerated fluid dynamics.

tools.name: morgen
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for Model Order Reduction in gas and energy networks
tools.detailed_description: morgen (Model Order Reduction for Gas and Energy Networks) is a MATLAB toolbox developed by MPI Magdeburg. It provides tools for reducing the complexity of gas and energy network models while preserving their essential dynamics.

tools.name: SROMPy
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for generating Stochastic Reduced Order Models (SROMs)
tools.detailed_description: SROMPy is a Python module developed by NASA for generating Stochastic Reduced Order Models (SROMs). It is used to efficiently represent uncertain input parameters in computational models, facilitating uncertainty quantification and propagation.

tools.name: UQPCE
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty Quantification using Polynomial Chaos Expansion surrogate modeling
tools.detailed_description: UQPCE is a Python-based research code from NASA for Uncertainty Quantification (UQ) using Polynomial Chaos Expansion (PCE). It utilizes non-intrusive PCE surrogate modeling techniques to efficiently estimate uncertainties in parametric computational studies.

tools.name: NeuralOperator
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for learning in infinite dimensions with neural operators
tools.detailed_description: A core library for implementing Neural Operators (like FNO) in PyTorch, enabling resolution-invariant solution of PDEs and operator learning tasks.

tools.name: SMPT
tools.one_line_profile: SMT-based model checker for Petri nets
tools.detailed_description: A Satisfiability Modulo Theories (SMT) based model checker designed for reachability analysis in Petri nets, which are used for modeling distributed systems and biological networks.

tools.name: operalib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for learning with operator-valued kernels
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing operator-valued kernels for machine learning tasks, useful for vector-valued regression and functional data analysis.

tools.name: OMD
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB package for Optimal Mode Decomposition and DMD
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB package for computing Optimal Mode Decomposition (OMD) and Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD), developed by the Oxford Control Group for analyzing dynamical systems.

tools.name: nmor
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for model reduction of dynamical systems
tools.detailed_description: A framework leveraging deep learning techniques for non-linear model order reduction (MOR) of dynamical systems, facilitating faster simulations.

tools.name: NodeLab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB repository for meshfree methods and PINNs
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for node generation and adaptive refinement to support meshfree methods, Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), and DeepONet for solving PDEs.

tools.name: PDEBench
tools.one_line_profile: Extensive benchmark suite for Scientific Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark dataset and code suite for evaluating machine learning methods on various Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) across different domains.

tools.name: NeuralFoil
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed machine learning tool for airfoil aerodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A practical tool for airfoil aerodynamic analysis that utilizes physics-informed machine learning to provide rapid predictions, exposed as a Python library.

tools.name: pi-optimal
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Reinforcement Learning in dynamic systems control
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library designed to model, optimize, and control dynamic systems using Reinforcement Learning (RL) techniques.

tools.name: SLIM
tools.one_line_profile: Stable linear layers for physics-informed machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A library providing drop-in replacements for PyTorch nn.Linear layers, designed to improve stability and incorporate inductive priors in physics-informed machine learning applications.

tools.name: SKDMD
tools.one_line_profile: Sparsity-promoting Kernel Dynamic Mode Decomposition
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Sparsity-promoting Kernel Dynamic Mode Decomposition (SKDMD) for analyzing nonlinear dynamical systems and extracting coherent structures.

tools.name: pyMOR
tools.one_line_profile: Model Order Reduction with Python
tools.detailed_description: A software library for building model order reduction applications, particularly for parametrized partial differential equations (PDEs). It supports various reduction methods and integrates with external PDE solvers.

tools.name: ConvDO
tools.one_line_profile: Convolutional Differential Operators for Physics-based Deep Learning
tools.detailed_description: A library providing convolutional differential operators to facilitate physics-based deep learning studies, enabling the integration of differential constraints into neural networks.

tools.name: gd-qpt
tools.one_line_profile: Gradient-descent quantum process tomography
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing quantum process tomography by learning Kraus operators using gradient descent, useful for characterizing quantum channels and gates.

tools.name: redbKIT
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB library for reduced-order modeling of parametrized PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB library designed for model order reduction of parametrized partial differential equations, providing tools for simulation and reduced basis generation.

tools.name: profit
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic Response Model Fitting with Interactive Tools
tools.detailed_description: A framework for surrogate modeling and uncertainty quantification, providing tools for fitting probabilistic response models to simulation data.

tools.name: torch-cfd
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Operator-Assisted Computational Fluid Dynamics in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library for accelerating computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations using neural operators, facilitating the integration of deep learning with traditional CFD solvers.

tools.name: FNO4CO2
tools.one_line_profile: Learned coupled inversion framework for carbon sequestration monitoring using Fourier Neural Operators
tools.detailed_description: A scientific machine learning tool that utilizes Fourier Neural Operators (FNO) for coupled inversion tasks, specifically designed for monitoring and forecasting carbon sequestration processes in geophysics.

tools.name: dfno
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed implementation of Fourier Neural Operators for large-scale scientific machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python library enabling distributed training and inference of Fourier Neural Operators (FNO), designed to scale operator learning models for high-dimensional physics simulations.

tools.name: LAMP
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning-based surrogate model with joint evolution learning and mesh optimization
tools.detailed_description: A surrogate modeling tool that jointly learns the evolution model of a physical system and optimizes computational costs via remeshing, presented at ICLR 2023.

tools.name: KoopmanMPC_Quadrotor
tools.one_line_profile: Koopman operator-based Model Predictive Control for quadrotor dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit implementing data-driven control using Koopman operator theory, specifically applied to the dynamics and control of quadrotors.

tools.name: DL-ROM-Meth
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning-based reduced order models for nonlinear time-dependent PDEs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of deep learning-based reduced order models (DL-ROM) designed to solve nonlinear time-dependent parametrized Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) efficiently.

tools.name: POD-DL-ROM
tools.one_line_profile: Enhanced reduced order models using POD and deep learning for parametrized PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A tool combining Proper Orthogonal Decomposition (POD) with deep learning to create enhanced reduced order models for nonlinear parametrized PDEs, improving efficiency over standard DL-ROMs.

tools.name: PhaseNO
tools.one_line_profile: Phase Neural Operator for modeling dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the Phase Neural Operator, a specialized operator learning architecture designed to capture phase-dependent dynamics in physical systems.

tools.name: gwsurrogate
tools.one_line_profile: Interface to gravitational wave surrogate models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing an easy-to-use interface for evaluating surrogate models of gravitational waveforms, used in astrophysics for efficient signal generation and analysis.

tools.name: TensorDiffEq
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable Physics-Informed Deep Learning framework on TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for efficient and scalable Physics-Informed Deep Learning (PINNs) and Scientific Machine Learning, built on TensorFlow with support for multi-worker distributed computing.

tools.name: neurop_invdes
tools.one_line_profile: Neural operator surrogates for electromagnetic inverse design
tools.detailed_description: A tool utilizing neural operators as surrogate models to accelerate inverse design processes in electromagnetics and photonics.

tools.name: NUNO
tools.one_line_profile: Non-Uniform Neural Operator for solving PDEs on irregular grids
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the Non-Uniform Neural Operator (NUNO), designed to handle operator learning tasks on non-uniform meshes and grids efficiently.

tools.name: Diffusion-based-Flow-Prediction
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty-aware surrogate models for airfoil flow simulations using diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPM) as uncertainty-aware surrogates for predicting fluid flow around airfoils, enabling probabilistic simulation.

tools.name: snapshot_pod_rom_py
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of Snapshot POD for reduced order modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to calculate Proper Orthogonal Decomposition (POD) modes from snapshot data and generate reduced order models (ROM) for system dynamics.

tools.name: Kinetic.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Universal modeling and simulation of fluid mechanics using machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for modeling and simulation of fluid mechanics based on the Boltzmann equation, integrating machine learning for multiscale and multiphysics flows.

tools.name: GAN-ROM
tools.one_line_profile: GAN-based reduced-order model framework for time series prediction and data assimilation
tools.detailed_description: A framework utilizing Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN) within a Reduced-Order Model (ROM) context to handle time series prediction, data assimilation, and uncertainty quantification for dynamical systems.

tools.name: H_Kriging
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of Hierarchical Kriging surrogate models
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB library for constructing Hierarchical Kriging models, a type of variable fidelity surrogate model that improves upon co-Kriging for multi-fidelity data fusion.

tools.name: EasySurrogate
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for creating surrogate models of multiscale systems
tools.detailed_description: Part of the VECMA toolkit, this tool facilitates the creation and deployment of surrogate models specifically designed for multiscale simulations and uncertainty quantification.

tools.name: Denovo-Pinal
tools.one_line_profile: Text-guided de novo protein design model
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for generating protein structures based on textual descriptions, enabling text-guided de novo protein design.

tools.name: Koopman-Neural-Network-Training
tools.one_line_profile: Software for training neural networks via Koopman operator theory
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB software package for optimizing and training neural networks by leveraging Koopman operator theory to linearize nonlinear dynamics in the latent space.

tools.name: turbulence-modeling-PIML
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed machine learning framework for Reynolds stress turbulence modeling
tools.detailed_description: A data-driven framework for Reynolds stress modeling in turbulence simulations using physics-informed machine learning (PIML) techniques to improve RANS predictions.

tools.name: cDMDc
tools.one_line_profile: Compressive Dynamic Mode Decomposition with Control (cDMDc) implementation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of Compressive Dynamic Mode Decomposition with Control (cDMDc) for system identification and dynamics modeling from compressive measurements.

tools.name: MACE
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and accurate machine learning interatomic potentials with higher order equivariant message passing
tools.detailed_description: MACE provides fast and accurate machine learning interatomic potentials using higher order equivariant message passing neural networks. It is designed for atomistic simulations in physics, chemistry, and materials science, enabling high-fidelity molecular dynamics and property prediction.

tools.name: MOFSimBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating universal ML interatomic potentials in MOF molecular modeling
tools.detailed_description: MOFSimBench is a benchmark suite designed to evaluate the performance of universal machine learning interatomic potentials specifically for metal-organic frameworks (MOFs). It facilitates the assessment of model accuracy and transferability in complex molecular modeling tasks.

tools.name: Molecules_Dataset_Collection
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of molecular datasets for property inference validation
tools.detailed_description: A collection of datasets containing molecular structures and properties, intended for the validation of property inference models in cheminformatics and molecular physics.

tools.name: trackml-library
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for the TrackML particle tracking challenge
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing utilities for reading, processing, and analyzing data from the TrackML High Energy Physics particle tracking challenge. It assists in the development of algorithms for reconstructing particle trajectories.

tools.name: Darwin
tools.one_line_profile: Foundational large language model for natural science
tools.detailed_description: Darwin is an open-source project dedicated to building a foundational large language model tailored for natural sciences, with a focus on physics, chemistry, and materials science, enabling scientific text understanding and potential property inference.

tools.name: Open-Catalyst-Dataset
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow and tools for the Open Catalyst Dataset
tools.detailed_description: Provides workflows and tools for creating, managing, and analyzing the Open Catalyst Dataset, which is designed for training ML models to simulate catalytic reactions and predict molecular energy and forces.

tools.name: The Well
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale collection of physics simulation datasets
tools.detailed_description: The Well is a massive (15TB) collection of physics simulation datasets covering various physical systems (fluids, mechanics, etc.), designed to serve as a benchmark for physics-informed machine learning and foundation models.

tools.name: QuantumLattices.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package for constructing quantum lattice systems
tools.detailed_description: QuantumLattices.jl is a Julia package designed for the construction and manipulation of quantum lattice systems, facilitating numerical computations in quantum many-body physics.

tools.name: ANI1x_datasets
tools.one_line_profile: ANI-1ccx and ANI-1x datasets for organic molecules
tools.detailed_description: Provides the ANI-1ccx and ANI-1x datasets, containing coupled-cluster and density functional theory (DFT) properties for organic molecules, used for training machine learning potentials.

tools.name: ANI-1xnr
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning interatomic potential for condensed-phase reactive chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning interatomic potential model designed for condensed-phase reactive chemistry, enabling molecular dynamics simulations of complex reactive systems.

tools.name: mlipx
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for evaluating and exploring machine-learned interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for evaluating, visualizing, and comparing machine-learned interatomic potentials (MLIPs), offering a suite of methods to assess model performance.

tools.name: MoleculeNet
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark datasets and splits for molecular machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A collection of benchmark datasets and splitting mechanisms for molecular machine learning, maintained by the DeepChem community to facilitate algorithm development and comparison.

tools.name: LAMBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for Large Atomistic Models
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool designed to evaluate the performance and accuracy of Large Atomistic Models (LAMs), developed by the DeepModeling community.

tools.name: ANI-1 Dataset
tools.one_line_profile: A dataset of 20 million calculated off-equilibrium conformations for organic molecules
tools.detailed_description: The ANI-1 dataset contains DFT-calculated geometries and energies for organic molecules, designed for training machine learning interatomic potentials.

tools.name: ASE_ANI
tools.one_line_profile: ANI-1 neural network potential interface for ASE
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface that allows using the ANI-1 neural network potential within the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) for molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: Matbench Discovery
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation framework for ML models in high-throughput materials discovery
tools.detailed_description: A framework for benchmarking machine learning models on their ability to simulate high-throughput materials discovery processes and predict stable materials.

tools.name: JARVIS-FF
tools.one_line_profile: Data and scripts for evaluating interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing data and LAMMPS scripts for the evaluation of interatomic potentials and force-fields, part of the JARVIS-FF project.

tools.name: Matbench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarks for materials science property prediction
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite for evaluating state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms on a diverse set of materials science datasets and properties.

tools.name: pymatgen
tools.one_line_profile: Python Materials Genomics library for materials analysis
tools.detailed_description: A robust open-source Python library for materials analysis, defining core classes for structures and molecules, and providing interfaces to electronic structure codes.

tools.name: lineshape_tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for evaluating electron-phonon coupling effects on optical properties
tools.detailed_description: Python software implementing formulations to evaluate the effects of electron-phonon coupling on the optical properties of defects in materials.

tools.name: qm9pack
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for data-mining the QM9 dataset
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to facilitate the access and data-mining of the QM9 dataset, which contains quantum chemical properties for small organic molecules.

tools.name: go-trackml
tools.one_line_profile: Go library for handling TrackML Particle Tracking Challenge data
tools.detailed_description: A Go package designed to simplify reading and processing data from the High Energy Physics Tracking Machine Learning challenge (TrackML). It provides utilities for data loading and evaluation metrics specific to particle tracking tasks.

tools.name: simple-equivariant-gnn
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of E(n) Equivariant Graph Neural Networks
tools.detailed_description: A concise and reusable PyTorch implementation of E(n) Equivariant Graph Neural Networks (EGNN). This architecture is critical in AI for Science for modeling particle dynamics, molecular structures, and many-body systems where rotation and translation equivariance are required.

tools.name: TrackML_CombinatorialTracker
tools.one_line_profile: Combinatorial tracker for particle trajectory reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of a combinatorial tracking algorithm developed for the Kaggle TrackML Particle Tracking Challenge. It solves the problem of reconstructing particle trajectories from 3D hit points in high-energy physics detectors.

tools.name: ChemBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark datasets for molecular machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing benchmark datasets (MoleculeNet, MolMapNet) for training and evaluating machine learning models in chemistry and molecular physics. It supports tasks related to molecular property prediction and structure analysis.

tools.name: matbench-genmetrics
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for benchmarking generative materials models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing standardized metrics for evaluating generative models in materials science. It is inspired by Guacamol and CDVAE benchmarks and focuses on assessing the quality and validity of generated crystal structures and material compositions.

tools.name: kaggle-trackML-solution
tools.one_line_profile: Solution for TrackML Particle Tracking Challenge
tools.detailed_description: A specific implementation of tracking algorithms (ranked #7) for the TrackML Particle Tracking Challenge. It serves as a reference solver for particle trajectory reconstruction tasks in high-energy physics.

tools.name: jarvis_leaderboard
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale benchmark for materials design methods
tools.detailed_description: The official codebase for the JARVIS leaderboard, facilitating the benchmarking of various materials design methods (AI, DFT, etc.). It allows researchers to compare performance on standardized tasks within materials science and physics.
